text.1: Allah bersumpah dengan fajar. Fajar yang dimaksud adalah fajar yaumun-nahr (hari penyembelihan kurban), yaitu tanggal 10 Zulhijah, karena ayat berikutnya membicarakan "malam yang sepuluh", yaitu sepuluh hari pertama bulan itu. Akan tetapi, ada yang berpendapat bahwa fajar yang dimaksud adalah fajar setiap hari yang mulai menyingsing yang menandakan malam sudah berakhir dan siang sudah dimulai. Ada pula yang berpendapat bahwa fajar itu adalah fajar 1 Muharram sebagai awal tahun, atau fajar 1 Zulhijah sebagai bulan pelaksanaan ibadah haji.
text.2:
Berikutnya Allah bersumpah dengan "malam yang sepuluh". Yang dimaksud adalah sepuluh hari pertama bulan Zulhijah, yang merupakan hari-hari yang sangat dimuliakan beramal pada hari-hari tersebut, sebagaimana diinformasikan hadis berikut:

Tidak ada hari apa pun berbuat baik lebih dicintai Allah padanya daripada hari-hari ini. (Riwayat al-Bukhari dari Ibnu 'Abbas)

Akan tetapi, ada yang berpendapat bahwa yang dimaksud adalah sepuluh hari pertama bulan Muharram, atau sepuluh hari pertama bulan Ramadan, atau sepuluh hari pertama setiap bulan.
text.3: Berikutnya lagi Allah bersumpah dengan "yang genap dan yang ganjil". "Yang genap adalah yaumun-nahr di atas, yaitu tanggal 10 Zulhijah, dan "yang ganjil" adalah hari 'Arafah, yaitu tanggal 9 Zulhijah. Itu adalah hari-hari yang dimuliakan juga. Tanggal 9 Zulhijah adalah hari wukuf di 'Arafah, yaitu hari dimulainya ibadah haji, dan tanggal 10 Zulhijah adalah hari mulai penyembelihan hewan kurban.
text.4:
Selanjutnya Allah bersumpah dengan "malam ketika berlalu". Malam yang dimaksud adalah malam ketika jamaah haji sudah berlalu dari 'Arafah dan singgah di Muzdalifah dalam perjalanan menuju Mina dalam pelaksanaan ibadah haji.

Demikianlah Allah bersumpah dengan hari-hari dalam pelaksanaan ibadah haji untuk menunjukkan bahwa ibadah haji itu besar maknanya dalam pandangan Allah. Hal itu karena ibadah haji itu mengingatkan manusia tentang adanya kematian. Dengan ingat kematian, manusia diharapkan beriman dan berbuat baik.

Ayat ini juga bisa ditafsirkan bahwa Allah bersumpah dengan hari-hari yang terus silih berganti untuk menunjukkan bahwa Allah Mahakuasa memelihara dan mengelola alam. Bila sudah tiba waktunya, yaitu hari Kiamat, Ia Mahakuasa pula menghancurkannya dan menghidupkannya kembali
text.5:
Pesan yang ingin disampaikan Allah dengan bersumpah di atas adalah bahwa orang yang mau menggunakan akalnya harusnya mengerti bahwa Allah Mahakuasa mengadakan, memelihara, menghancurkan, dan menghidupkan kembali alam ini. Oleh karena itu, mereka seharusnya beriman dan berbuat baik. 

Ayat ini merupakan peringatan bagi kaum kafir Mekah pada saat ayat ini turun, agar beriman kepada Allah dan hari kemudian, berbuat baik, dan meninggalkan perbuatan jahat mereka. Juga menjadi peringatan bagi seluruh umat manusia
text.6: Allah bertanya kepada Nabi Muhammad, yang maksudnya untuk memberitahukan kepada beliau atau siapa saja untuk direnungkan, tentang kaum 'Ad. Kaum ini adalah umat Nabi Hud yang mendiami daerah yang disebut Ahqaf di daerah Hadramaut, Yaman. 'Ad adalah nama nenek moyang mereka, 'Ad bin Iram bin Sam bin Nuh. Mereka diberi nama dengan nama nenek moyang mereka itu. Mereka terkenal sebagai bangsa yang kuat dan memiliki tubuh yang tinggi, besar, dan perkasa. Bukti keperkasaan mereka adalah bahwa mereka telah mampu membangun kota yang disebut Iram dengan gedung-gedung yang kokoh, tinggi, dan megah untuk ukuran pada masa itu. Mereka juga menguasai bangsa-bangsa sekitarnya. Walaupun demikian perkasa dan memiliki peradaban yang tinggi, Allah tetap mampu menghancurkan mereka sehingga hanya tinggal nama. Semua itu akibat pembangkangan mereka kepada Allah dan kesewenang-wenangan mereka kepada manusia.

text.9:
Begitu juga Allah telah menghancurleburkan kaum Samud, umat Nabi Saleh. Bangsa ini juga telah memiliki peradaban yang tinggi, yang ditunjukkan oleh kemampuan mereka membangun gedung-gedung megah di tempat-tempat datar dan memotong, memahat batu-batu di pegunungan untuk dibuat tempat-tempat peristirahatan, serta membuat relief-relief dan perhiasan-perhiasan dari batu atau marmer. Keahlian mereka itu diceritakan dalam ayat lain:

Dan kamu pahat dengan terampil sebagian gunung-gunung untuk dijadikan rumah-rumah. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 149)

Walaupun mereka sudah begitu maju, kuat, dan memiliki peradaban yang tinggi, Allah tetap kuasa menghancurkan mereka karena pembangkangan mereka.
text.10: Allah juga telah menghancurkan Fir'aun. Ia terkenal sebagai raja yang zalim bahkan memandang dirinya tuhan bangsa Mesir. Bangsa ini di bawah Fir'aun juga telah mencapai peradaban yang tinggi, di antara buktinya adalah kemampuan mereka membangun piramid-piramid yang merupakan salah satu keajaiban dunia sampai sekarang. Mereka juga telah memiliki angkatan bersenjata yang besar. Akan tetapi, semuanya itu juga sudah dihancurleburkan Allah sehingga sekarang mereka hanya tinggal nama untuk dikenang.
text.11: Semua bangsa yang telah disebutkan di atas, yaitu kaum 'Ad, Samud, dan Fir'aun telah melakukan kesewenang-wenangan di bumi ini, yaitu mempertuhankan manusia atau benda dan memperkosa hak-hak asasi manusia.
text.12: Di samping itu, mereka telah melakukan kerusakan di muka bumi, seperti menindas kaum yang lemah bahkan membunuh siapa saja yang mereka kehendaki.
text.13:
Akhirnya Allah "menumpahkan kepada mereka cemeti azab", yang berarti bahwa azab itu dicurahkan seluruhnya kepada mereka sehebat-hebatnya, sehingga mereka hancur lebur tak bersisa dan yang tertinggal hanyalah nama untuk diingat orang. Yang menimpakan azab itu adalah "Tuhanmu" (ya, Muhammad!), yang berarti bahwa peristiwa-peristiwa itu hendaknya menjadi pelajaran bagi kaum kafir Mekah agar mereka tidak terus-menerus membangkang.

Bagaimana azab yang ditimpakan kepada bangsa-bangsa itu dinyatakan dalam ayat-ayat lain:

Maka adapun kaum Samud, mereka telah dibinasakan dengan suara yang sangat keras, sedangkan kaum 'Ad, mereka telah dibinasakan dengan angin topan yang sangat dingin, Allah menimpakan angin itu kepada mereka selama tujuh malam delapan hari terus-menerus; maka kamu melihat kaum 'Ad pada waktu itu mati bergelimpangan seperti batang-batang pohon kurma yang telah kosong (lapuk). Maka adakah kamu melihat seorang pun yang masih tersisa di antara mereka? Kemudian datang Fir'aun dan orang-orang yang sebelumnya dan (penduduk) negeri-negeri yang dijungkirbalikkan karena kesalahan yang besar. Maka mereka mendurhakai utusan Tuhannya, Allah menyiksa mereka dengan siksaan yang sangat keras. (al-haqqah/69: 5-10)
text.14: Allah menegaskan bahwa Ia sungguh amat kuat pengawasan-Nya terhadap makhluk-Nya. Tidak ada perbuatan sekecil apa pun yang tidak diketahui-Nya. Oleh karena itu, yang membangkang dan bergelimang dosa seharusnya sadar dan kemudian beriman dan tobat dari dosa-dosanya.
text.15: Ayat ini menyatakan bahwa Allah menguji manusia dengan kemuliaan dan berbagai nikmat-Nya, seperti kekuasaan dan kekayaan. Orang yang kafir dan durhaka akan memandang hal itu sebagai tanda bahwa Allah menyayangi mereka.
text.16: Sebaliknya, bila Allah menguji mereka dengan cara membatasi rezeki, mereka menyangka bahwa Allah telah membenci mereka. Pandangan itu tidak benar, karena Allah memberi siapa yang disukai-Nya atau tidak memberi siapa yang tidak disukai-Nya. Allah ingin menguji manusia, dan karena itu Ia menghendaki agar manusia itu selalu patuh kepada-Nya, baik dalam keadaan berkecukupan maupun kekurangan. Bila Allah memberi, maka manusia yang diberi harus bersyukur, dan bila Ia tidak memberi, manusia harus bersabar.
text.17: Akan tetapi banyak manusia yang ingkar, mereka tidak mensyukuri nikmat yang diberikan kepadanya. Bersyukur adalah mengucapkan kata-kata syukur dan menggunakan nikmat itu sesuai dengan ketentuan Yang Memberinya. Salah satu ketentuan-Nya adalah bahwa orang yang diberi kelebihan rezeki harus memperhatikan mereka yang berkekurangan. Di antara mereka adalah anak-anak yatim. Anak yatim perlu diasuh sampai mereka dewasa. Manusia yang ingkar dan tak mau bersyukur tidak mau memperhatikan pengasuhan anak-anak yatim itu.
text.18: Di samping itu, mereka tidak menaruh kasihan pada penderitaan orang miskin. Jangankan untuk melepaskan mereka dari kemiskinan, membantu mencukupkan kebutuhan pokok mereka saja mereka tidak ada perhatian.
text.19: Tambahan lagi manusia yang ingkar dan durhaka itu sangat tamak. Mereka tega merampas harta warisan yang menjadi hak anak yatim secara akal-akalan, misalnya mencampurkannya ke dalam kekayaan mereka lalu menyatakan bahwa yang mereka makan adalah harta mereka sendiri.
text.20:
Orang yang durhaka itu terus mencari dan mengumpulkan kekayaan tanpa mengenal rasa lelah dan tidak peduli halal atau haram. Di samping itu, mereka sangat pelit, tidak mau mengeluarkan kewajiban berkenaan harta, yaitu membayar zakat dan membantu orang yang berkekurangan.

Allah tidak mungkin sayang kepada orang kaya raya yang memperoleh kekayaan itu dengan cara yang tidak benar. Juga kepada orang yang tidak mau membantu orang lain. Mereka jangan mengira bahwa mereka memperoleh kekayaan itu sebagai tanda bahwa Allah menyayangi mereka. Sebaliknya, Allah sesungguhnya membenci mereka. Tidak mustahil mereka akan dijatuhi azab seperti yang telah ditimpakan-Nya kepada umat-umat terdahulu itu. Di akhirat nanti, Allah akan memasukkan mereka ke dalam neraka. Hakikat ini hendaknya disadari oleh kaum kafir Mekah yang masih juga membangkang. Hal itu hendaknya dijadikan pelajaran oleh seluruh umat manusia.
text.21: Dalam ayat ini, Allah memberitahukan bahwa orang-orang kafir itu nanti di akhirat akan menyesal. Allah memberitahukan bahwa dunia ini akan hancur karena planet-planet ini akan bertubrukan satu sama lain dengan dahsyatnya dan semua makhluk akan mati. Setelah itu Allah menghidupkan semua makhluk itu kembali dan menghadapkan mereka di Padang Mahsyar. Kemudian Allah dan para malaikat yang membuat formasi-formasi khusus memeriksa setiap amal manusia. Waktu itulah neraka Jahanam dihadapkan kepada orang-orang yang durhaka ketika di dunia. Waktu itu mereka yang durhaka sadar atas kedurhakaannya. Akan tetapi, sadar pada waktu itu tidak ada gunanya, karena "nasi sudah jadi bubur", dunia tempat beramal sudah berakhir, dan yang ada hanyalah tempat melihat hasil amal di dunia.

text.24: Ketika itu orang-orang yang durhaka menyesali diri mereka mengapa dulu di dunia tidak melakukan sesuatu yang berguna untuk kehidupannya di akhirat.
text.25: Di akhirat, yang ada hanya azab bagi orang yang durhaka. Azab itu tiada tara sehingga tidak ada bandingannya. Azab itu dijatuhkan sesuai dengan dosa-dosa mereka pada waktu di dunia.
text.26: Pada waktu itu tidak ada yang lebih dipercaya dalam melaksanakan tugasnya selain Malaikat Zabaniyah. Malaikat itu akan melaksanakan tugasnya persis sebagaimana yang diperintahkan Allah, yaitu bahwa orang-orang yang durhaka itu akan diazab di dalam neraka Jahanam sesuai dengan dosa-dosa mereka. Dengan demikian, terbuktilah bahwa kelimpahan nikmat yang mereka terima pada waktu di dunia itu bukanlah tanda bahwa Allah cinta kepada mereka.
text.27: Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah memanggil jiwa yang tenang dan damai ketika diwafatkan, yaitu jiwa yang suci karena iman dan amal saleh yang dikerjakannya, sehingga memperoleh apa yang dijanjikan Allah kepadanya. Jiwa itu diminta Allah untuk pulang memenuhi panggilan-Nya dengan menghadap kepada-Nya kembali dengan perasaan puas dan senang karena telah memenuhi perintah-perintah-Nya waktu hidup di dunia. Allah juga puas dan senang kepadanya karena sudah menjalankan perintah-perintah-Nya. Setelah datang kepada-Nya, jiwa itu dipersilakan Allah masuk ke dalam kelompok hamba-hamba-Nya, yaitu ke dalam surga-Nya.

en.name: The Dawn
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: Allah swears by the dawn. The dawn referred to is the dawn of *yaumun-nahr* (the day of sacrifice), which is the 10th of Zulhijah, because the following verse discusses "the ten nights," which are the first ten days of that month. However, some are of the opinion that the dawn referred to is the dawn of every day that begins to break, signifying the end of the night and the beginning of the day. There are also those who are of the opinion that the dawn is the dawn of 1 Muharram as the beginning of the year, or the dawn of 1 Zulhijah as the month of performing the Hajj pilgrimage.
text.2:
Next, Allah swears by "the ten nights." What is meant is the first ten days of the month of Dhul-Hijjah, which are days when performing good deeds is highly esteemed, as informed by the following hadith:

There are no days in which doing good is more beloved to Allah than these days. (Narrated by al-Bukhari from Ibn 'Abbas)

However, some are of the opinion that what is meant is the first ten days of the month of Muharram, or the first ten days of the month of Ramadan, or the first ten days of every month.
text.3: Next, Allah swears by "the even and the odd." "The even" is *yaumun-nahr* mentioned above, which is the 10th of Zulhijah, and "the odd" is the day of 'Arafah, which is the 9th of Zulhijah. These are also days that are glorified. The 9th of Zulhijah is the day of *wukuf* in 'Arafah, which is the day the Hajj pilgrimage begins, and the 10th of Zulhijah is the day the sacrifice of sacrificial animals begins.
text.4:
Furthermore, Allah swears by "the night when it departs." The night referred to is the night when the pilgrims have departed from 'Arafah and stopped at Muzdalifah on their way to Mina in the performance of the Hajj.

Thus, Allah swears by the days in the performance of the Hajj to show that the Hajj pilgrimage is of great significance in Allah's sight. This is because the Hajj pilgrimage reminds people of death. By remembering death, people are expected to believe and do good deeds.

This verse can also be interpreted as Allah swearing by the days that constantly alternate to show that Allah is All-Powerful in maintaining and managing the universe. When the time comes, namely the Day of Judgment, He is also All-Powerful to destroy it and bring it back to life.
text.5:
The message Allah wants to convey by swearing the oaths above is that those who are willing to use their intellect should understand that Allah is All-Powerful to create, maintain, destroy, and resurrect this universe. Therefore, they should believe and do good deeds.

This verse is a warning to the disbelievers of Mecca at the time this verse was revealed, to believe in Allah and the Hereafter, to do good deeds, and to abandon their evil deeds. It is also a warning to all of mankind.
text.6: Allah asks the Prophet Muhammad, the intention being to inform him or anyone else to reflect upon, about the people of 'Ad. This community was the people of Prophet Hud who inhabited a region called Ahqaf in the Hadramaut area of Yemen. 'Ad is the name of their ancestor, 'Ad bin Iram bin Sam bin Nuh. They were named after their ancestor. They were known as a strong nation with tall, large, and mighty bodies. Evidence of their might is that they were able to build a city called Iram with sturdy, tall, and magnificent buildings for the standards of that time. They also dominated the surrounding nations. Despite being so mighty and possessing a high civilization, Allah was still able to destroy them so that only their name remains. All of this was due to their disobedience to Allah and their tyranny towards mankind.

This community was the people of Prophet Hud who inhabited a region called Ahqaf in the Hadramaut area of Yemen. 'Ad is the name of their ancestor, 'Ad bin Iram bin Sam bin Nuh. They were named after their ancestor. They were known as a strong nation with tall, large, and mighty bodies. Despite being so mighty and having a high civilization, Allah was still able to destroy them so that only their name remains. All of this was a result of their disobedience to Allah and their tyranny towards mankind.
text.8: Allah asks Prophet Muhammad, the intention being to inform him or anyone to reflect upon, about the people of 'Ad. This people were the community of Prophet Hud who inhabited a region called Ahqaf in the Hadramaut area, Yemen. 'Ad is the name of their ancestor, 'Ad bin Iram bin Sam bin Nuh. They were named after their ancestor. They were known as a strong nation with tall, large, and mighty bodies. Evidence of their might is that they were able to build a city called Iram with sturdy, tall, and magnificent buildings for the standards of that time. They also dominated the surrounding nations. Despite being so mighty and possessing a high civilization, Allah was still able to destroy them, leaving only their name behind. All of this was due to their disobedience to Allah and their tyranny towards mankind.
text.9:
Similarly, Allah destroyed the Thamud people, the people of Prophet Saleh. This nation also possessed a high civilization, demonstrated by their ability to build magnificent buildings in flat areas and cut and carve rocks in the mountains to create places of rest, as well as making reliefs and ornaments from stone or marble. Their expertise is narrated in another verse:

"And you carve skillfully into the mountains, making houses." (ash-Shu'ara'/26: 149)

Even though they were so advanced, strong, and possessed a high civilization, Allah still had the power to destroy them because of their disobedience.
text.10: Allah also destroyed Pharaoh. He was known as a tyrannical king who even considered himself the god of the Egyptian people. Under Pharaoh, this nation had also achieved a high level of civilization, one of the proofs of which is their ability to build pyramids that remain one of the wonders of the world to this day. They also possessed a large armed force. However, all of that was also utterly destroyed by Allah, so that now they are only a name to be remembered.
text.11: All the nations mentioned above, namely the people of 'Ad, Thamud, and Pharaoh, had committed tyranny on earth, which was to deify humans or objects and violate fundamental human rights.
text.12: Besides that, they had committed corruption on the earth, such as oppressing the weak and even killing anyone they pleased.
text.13:
Finally, Allah "poured upon them a scourge of punishment," meaning that the punishment was poured out upon them completely and with the greatest severity, so that they were utterly destroyed without a trace, and only their names remained to be remembered. The One who inflicted the punishment was "Your Lord" (O Muhammad!), meaning that these events should be a lesson for the disbelievers of Mecca so that they would not continue to rebel.

How the punishment inflicted upon those nations is stated in other verses:

"So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering cry. And as for 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious, bitterly cold wind. He subjected it to them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees. Then do you see of them any remnant remaining? And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin. And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment." (al-Haqqah/69: 5-10)
text.14: Allah affirms that His supervision over His creation is truly very strong. There is no deed, no matter how small, that is unknown to Him. Therefore, those who are rebellious and wallowing in sin should be aware and then believe and repent from their sins.
text.15: This verse states that Allah tests mankind with glory and various blessings, such as power and wealth. Those who are disbelieving and disobedient will view this as a sign that Allah loves them.
text.16: Conversely, when Allah tests them by restricting their sustenance, they assume that Allah has hated them. That view is incorrect, because Allah gives to whomever He pleases and does not give to whomever He does not please. Allah wants to test mankind, and therefore He desires that mankind always be obedient to Him, whether in a state of sufficiency or deficiency. If Allah gives, then the person given must be grateful, and if He does not give, then the person must be patient.
text.17: However, many people are ungrateful; they do not give thanks for the blessings bestowed upon them. Gratitude is expressing words of thanks and using the blessings in accordance with the stipulations of the One who gives them. One of His stipulations is that those who are given an abundance of sustenance should pay attention to those who are in need. Among those in need are orphans. Orphans need to be cared for until they reach adulthood. Ungrateful people who do not want to give thanks do not want to pay attention to the care of those orphans.
text.18: Furthermore, they have no compassion for the suffering of the poor. Let alone freeing them from poverty, they don't even pay attention to helping them meet their basic needs.
text.19: Furthermore, these disbelieving and disobedient people are very greedy. They are cruel enough to seize the inheritance that is the right of orphans through deceptive means, for example, by mixing it into their own wealth and then declaring that what they are consuming is their own property.
text.20:
The disobedient person continues to seek and accumulate wealth tirelessly, regardless of whether it is obtained through lawful (halal) or unlawful (haram) means. Furthermore, they are extremely stingy, unwilling to fulfill their obligations concerning wealth, namely paying zakat and helping those in need.

Allah is unlikely to have mercy on the wealthy who acquire their wealth through improper means, nor on those who are unwilling to help others. They should not assume that their acquisition of wealth is a sign that Allah loves them. On the contrary, Allah truly despises them. It is not impossible that they will be afflicted with punishment as He has inflicted upon previous nations. In the Hereafter, Allah will cast them into Hell. This reality should be realized by the disbelievers of Mecca who continue to rebel. This should be a lesson for all of humanity.
text.21: In this verse, Allah informs us that the disbelievers will later regret their actions in the afterlife. Allah informs us that the world will be destroyed because the planets will collide with each other violently and all creatures will die. After that, Allah will resurrect all creatures and bring them before Him in the Gathering Place (Padang Mahsyar). Then Allah and the angels, in special formations, will examine every human deed. At that time, Hell (Jahanam) will be brought forth to those who were disobedient in the world. At that time, those who were disobedient will realize their disobedience. However, realizing it at that time is useless, because "the rice has already become porridge," the world, the place for doing good deeds, has ended, and all that remains is the place to see the results of deeds done in the world.
text.22: In this verse, Allah informs us that the disbelievers will later regret it in the afterlife. Allah informs us that this world will be destroyed because the planets will collide with each other violently and all creatures will die. After that, Allah will resurrect all those creatures and bring them before the Plain of Gathering (Padang Mahsyar). Then Allah and the angels who make special formations will examine every human deed. At that time, Hell (Jahanam) will be brought before those who were disobedient in the world. At that time, those who were disobedient will realize their disobedience. However, realizing it at that time is useless, because "the rice has already become porridge," the world, the place for doing good deeds, has ended, and all that remains is the place to see the results of deeds in the world.

text.24: At that time, the rebellious people regretted why they did not do anything useful for their life in the Hereafter when they were in the world.
text.25: In the afterlife, there will only be torment for those who are disobedient. That torment is unparalleled, so there is no comparison to it. That torment will be inflicted according to their sins during their time in the world.
text.26: At that time, there was no one more trusted in carrying out their duties than the Angel Zabaniyah. These angels would carry out their duties exactly as Allah commanded, which was that the disobedient would be punished in Hell Jahannam according to their sins. Thus, it was proven that the abundance of blessings they received while in the world was not a sign that Allah loved them.
text.27: In these verses, Allah calls to the tranquil and peaceful soul at the time of death, that is, the soul purified by faith and righteous deeds, thus obtaining what Allah has promised it. Allah asks that soul to return to fulfill His call by facing Him again with feelings of satisfaction and joy for having fulfilled His commands while living in the world. Allah is also pleased and happy with it for having carried out His commands. After coming to Him, that soul is welcomed by Allah to enter into the company of His servants, that is, into His Paradise.
